CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 7, 2019
CommentsContent: We have taken this chair on several camping trips now.  My husband has  a very bad back and he says it is very comfy, in fact, he has spent a lot of time napping in it.  One of the nuts has needed retightening a few times, but we always have a Leatherman with us which comes in handy for that.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2019
CommentsContent: My chair is, in one word, dreadful. I am returning it. Given the reviews, it seems that every chair is different. There must be an issue with quality assurance and control. I hope Amazon Basics will update with a version II.I am a mellow person. I rarely get angry. This product annoyed me so much I was tempted to throw it out the window. I would not even donate this. I have purchased $15 beach chairs that are more comfortable.About me: I am 5’6”, 160 pounds (overweight), in my early 40’s. I maintain good posture, practice yoga, but have had some minor neck problems due to hyper mobility. I love hammocks. My living space - 200 sq ft.  I bought this for 4 reasons: 1) using it in zero gravity mode for relaxing and meditating; 2) Napping;  3) Watching TV and reading at a slight incline; and 4) lounging outside when it is warmer. Easy to fold when not in use, etc. I really really wanted the Timber Line XL padded zero gravity chair, but I am on a budget.Review of The chair: It arrived undamaged. Note: If you want it in an Amazon box to surprise someone, select that option at checkout. Opened the box, the chair comes assembled, it folds nicely, and it was easy to carry upstairs. There are no directions, no paperwork. It isn’t difficult to figure out. It opened smoothly. On each side there is a little dial to unscrew to recline to desired level, then screw the other way to lock in position. All good so far!Then I sat in it. My head rests against the very uncomfortable metal bar. There is a small headrest/lumbar pillow. In the lumbar area the mesh hangs down and does not “hug” your back like a hammock. I tried moving up and down, there was no comfortable position. I wanted to ease back into the NASA zero gravity position. No luck. I got back far enough, about 140 degrees. No change in the lumbar area, I put a Mackenzie roll behind me to fill the gap to no avail. My head, using the “headrest”, sank into the upper metal bar. I immediately got a headache, so I got out. Even my lower back was bothering me. In 10 minutes I went from feeling fine to a terrible headache.In my opinion, my chair must be defective. Given so many other reviews where people are tumbling backwards, not reclining, having the chair collapse, etc. I am happy for the people who got a quality controlled recliner.For the rest of us, this is a very evil chair that causes pain. I recommend staying away from it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 26, 2018
CommentsContent: After only the second time using it, I was laying back in it and the thing gave way and I fell back and hit my neck and head on the cement. The reason I bought the chair was because I have two bulged discs in my neck.  Ridiculous!  Hopefully my neck is now not worse off.  Now the chair will not even work anymore.

CommentsContent: I bought this for my husband as an early Father’s Day present and the chair looks great and he says it’s very comfortable. He does say the locking feature doesn’t hold very well in a half recline position though. The reason for a four star versus a five star is because there are some contradictory information regarding the chair’s weight limit. The product description online says it will hold up to 300 lbs, but the paper that comes with the chair says 200 lbs. My husband is a little over 200 so it’s probably not that big of a deal, but it’s still confusing nonetheless.

CommentsTitle: Excellent, exactly what I was looking for
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2020
CommentsContent: This product was exactly what I wanted. I have extremely bad nerve pain at my tailbone and can not sit up or reclined for more than a few minutes. I usually stand while at work or lay down at home. I wanted to relax in my back yard and needed something that took the pressure off of my tail bone. A normal beach chair won't work for me. This char is perfect! It is easy to maneuver into the fully reclined position and took the pressure off of my lower back. The only modification I had to do was add some padding to where my ankles / lower calves rest on the foot rest area. I'm 6'4" and 180lbs so my legs hang over more than probably what the chair was designed for. Other than this everything else is great!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 27, 2019
CommentsContent: Awesome chair. I read all the reviews and felt confident that this would be a good value for the price. It impressed me. Very comfortable, folds small, easy to operate, all around awesome chair.  My only tiny concern is how you the twist-locks that keep the chair locked in a certain position (eg, upright, horizontal) quickly get loose and you can (inadvertently or intentionally) swing yourself into a different position. But it’s a tiny concern — it moves slowly, so the frustration is more with re-tightening all the time rather than any real fear of flipping horizontal. The positives of this chair, and the incredible price, make thins well worth it. I bought a second one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2019
CommentsContent: This is an amazingly comfortable chair. It allowed me to attend events that were previously not possible due to pain when sitting for more than a few moments. I could be up for hours at a time with no increase in pain. I purchased this for poolside parties at my daughters house. My son in law, who is more than a foot taller than me and twice my weight also loved it. It is a smash hit.

CommentsTitle: Getting into the chair isn't so easy...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2019
CommentsContent: Once you're in the chair feels great no matter what position you have it in. However, getting into the chair can be a bit of a challenge, especially for those of us who are older. The foot rest (as you can see from the picture) extends past the "feet" of the chair and does not sit flush with the ground. Standing in front of the chair and sitting down in a normal fashion is actually quite a drop. Straddling the foot rest is uncomfortable, but provides a shorter drop into the chair. I don't want to give mine up, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone else who is past the nimble stage of their life.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 20, 2020
CommentsContent: This chair is amazing! It’s the most comfortable reclining, lawn chairs I’ve ever sat/laid on! It’s portable, and easy to fold/unfold. The lock feature gives you the confidence and security that you want and need in a reclining chair. The headrest gives you the added cushion and comfort that you want in a reclining chair. The price is right for this chair. Overall I highly suggest purchasing this chair.
